member.name: T:Castle.MonoRail.Views.Brail.Macros.ComponentNaming
member.summary: we need to have a unique name, because of MR 371, nested components should not use the same name.

member.name: F:Castle.MonoRail.Views.Brail.BooViewEngine.compilations
member.summary: This field holds all the cache of all the compiled types (not instances) of all the views that Brail nows of.

member.name: F:Castle.MonoRail.Views.Brail.BooViewEngine.constructors
member.summary: used to hold the constructors of types, so we can avoid using Activator (which takes a long time

member.name: F:Castle.MonoRail.Views.Brail.BooViewEngine.typeToFileName
member.summary: Used to map between type and file name, this is useful when we want to remove a script by its type.

member.name: F:Castle.MonoRail.Views.Brail.BooViewEngine.common
member.summary: This is used to add a reference to the common scripts for each compiled scripts

member.name: M:Castle.MonoRail.Views.Brail.BooViewEngine.RenderStaticWithinLayout(System.String,Castle.MonoRail.Framework.IEngineContext,Castle.MonoRail.Framework.IController,Castle.MonoRail.Framework.IControllerContext)
member.summary: Wraps the specified content in the layout using the context to output the result.

member.name: M:Castle.MonoRail.Views.Brail.BooViewEngine.GetCompiledScriptInstance(System.String,System.IO.TextWriter,Castle.MonoRail.Framework.IEngineContext,Castle.MonoRail.Framework.IController,Castle.MonoRail.Framework.IControllerContext)
member.summary: This takes a filename and return an instance of the view ready to be used. If the file does not exist, an exception is raised The cache is checked to see if the file has already been compiled, and it had been a check is made to see that the compiled instance is newer then the file's modification date. If the file has not been compiled, or the version on disk is newer than the one in memory, a new version is compiled. Finally, an instance is created and returned

member.name: M:Castle.MonoRail.Views.Brail.BooViewEngine.DoCompile(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Boo.Lang.Compiler.ICompilerInput},System.String)
member.summary: Perform the actual compilation of the scripts Things to note here: * The generated assembly reference the Castle.MonoRail.MonoRailBrail and Castle.MonoRail.Framework assemblies * If a common scripts assembly exist, it is also referenced * The AddBrailBaseClassStep compiler step is added - to create a class from the view's code * The ProcessMethodBodiesWithDuckTyping is replaced with ReplaceUknownWithParameters this allows to use naked parameters such as (output context.IsLocal) without using any special syntax * The FixTryGetParameterConditionalChecks is run afterward, to transform "if ?Error" to "if not ?Error isa IgnoreNull" * The ExpandDuckTypedExpressions is replace with a derived step that allows the use of Dynamic Proxy assemblies * The IntroduceGlobalNamespaces step is removed, to allow to use common variables such as date and list without accidently using the Boo.Lang.BuiltIn versions

member.name: T:Castle.MonoRail.Views.Brail.BrailBase
member.summary: Base class for all the view scripts, this is the class that is responsible for support all the behind the scenes magic such as variable to PropertyBag trasnlation, resources usage, etc.

member.name: F:Castle.MonoRail.Views.Brail.BrailBase._dsl
member.summary: Reference to the DSL service

member.summary: This is used by layout scripts only, for outputing the child's content

member.name: M:Castle.MonoRail.Views.Brail.BrailBase.OutputSubView(System.String)
member.summary: Output the subview to the client, this is either a relative path "SubView" which is relative to the current /script/ or an "absolute" path "/home/menu" which is actually relative to ViewDirRoot

member.name: M:Castle.MonoRail.Views.Brail.BrailBase.OutputSubView(System.String,System.Collections.IDictionary)
member.summary: Similiar to the OutputSubView(string) function, but with a bunch of parameters that are used just for this subview. This parameters are /not/ inheritable.
member.returns: An empty string, just to make it possible to use inline ${OutputSubView("foo")}

member.name: M:Castle.MonoRail.Views.Brail.BrailBase.OutputSubView(System.String,System.IO.TextWriter,System.Collections.IDictionary)
member.summary: Outputs the sub view to the writer

member.name: M:Castle.MonoRail.Views.Brail.BrailBase.GetSubViewFilename(System.String)
member.summary: Get the sub view file name, if the subview starts with a '/' then the filename is considered relative to ViewDirRoot otherwise, it's relative to the current script directory

member.name: M:Castle.MonoRail.Views.Brail.BrailBase.GetParameter(System.String)
member.summary: this is called by ReplaceUnknownWithParameters step to create a more dynamic experiance any uknown identifier will be translate into a call for GetParameter('identifier name'). This mean that when an uknonwn identifier is in the script, it will only be found on runtime.

member.name: M:Castle.MonoRail.Views.Brail.BrailBase.TryGetParameter(System.String)
member.summary: this is called by ReplaceUnknownWithParameters step to create a more dynamic experiance any uknown identifier with the prefix of ? will be translated into a call for TryGetParameter('identifier name without the ? prefix'). This method will return null if the value it not found.

member.summary: Wraps the possilbe null value in an ignore value object

member.summary: Gets the parameter - implements the logic for searching parameters.

member.name: M:Castle.MonoRail.Views.Brail.BrailPreProcessor.EscapeNullPropagationsInOutputExpression(System.String)
member.summary: Given a brail output expression: ${...} replace any null propagations, while respecting quoted strings and escaped characters such as ("\"\"").

member.name: M:Castle.MonoRail.Views.Brail.BrailPreProcessor.FindPositionAfterClosingQuote(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Find the position after the end of the closing quote token for the quoted substring that started at the specified position
for example, given the following string x: "abc" blah 01234567890 FindPositionAfterClosingQuote(x, 1) will return 6
handles triple-double-quotes, double, and single quotes, and escaped quotes within the string
member.param: index of opening quote within the code fragment
member.returns: position after closing quote, or -1 if not found

member.name: M:Castle.MonoRail.Views.Brail.BrailPreProcessor.FindStartOfNextQuotedString(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the character position of the next instance of any boo string-quoting tokens: ', ", """ Note that this returns the position of the beginning of the quote token, not the text inside the quote

member.name: M:Castle.MonoRail.Views.Brail.BrailPreProcessor.GetExpressionsPositions(System.String)
member.summary: Will find all the (outer most ${} expressions in the code, and return their positions). Smart enough to figure out $${} escaping, but not much more

member.name: T:Castle.MonoRail.Views.Brail.ExpandDuckTypedExpressions_WorkaroundForDuplicateVirtualMethods
member.summary:
This is here because we need to overcome a tendecy of Dynamic Proxy to generate virtual override that do not match exactly what the compiler does. This means that when you do GetMethod("Foo") and DP has proxied it, you would get an exception because it would recognize two methods with this name. We recognize when we are trying to invoke something that DP has build and act accordingly.
The code is mostly taken fro Boo.Lang.Runtime.RuntimeServices, and modified to understand that when the type is from DP, is should use DeclareOnly

member.name: T:Castle.MonoRail.Views.Brail.FixTryGetParameterConditionalChecks
member.summary:
We need to handle the following code: if ?Error: end
However, because ?Op will return an IgnoreNull object, we can't just use the default boo behavior, but need to fix it up

member.name: M:Castle.MonoRail.Views.Brail.IgnoreNull.ExtractTarget(Castle.MonoRail.Views.Brail.IgnoreNull)
member.summary: Gets the underlying target object of the IgnorNull

member.name: M:Castle.MonoRail.Views.Brail.IgnoreNull.ReplaceIgnoreNullsWithTargets(System.Object[])
member.summary: Returns a new array copied from args that has replaced IgnoreNull instances with the underlying target object.

member.name: M:Castle.MonoRail.Views.Brail.IgnoreNull.ReplaceIgnoreNullsWithTargets(System.Collections.IDictionary)
member.summary: Replace all the values in the Hashtable that are marked as replaced values of IgnoreNull with the underlying target object.
member.returns: The original hashtable, with all the IgnoreNull values stripped to their targets

member.name: T:Castle.MonoRail.Views.Brail.ReplaceUknownWithParameters
member.summary: Replace any uknown identifier with a call to GetParameter('unknown') this mean that unknonwn identifier in scripts will only fail in run time if they were not defined by the controller.

member.name: M:Castle.MonoRail.Views.Brail.ReplaceUknownWithParameters.OnMethodInvocationExpression(Boo.Lang.Compiler.Ast.MethodInvocationExpression)
member.summary: This turn a call to TryGetParemeter('item') where item is a local variable into a WrapIfNull(item) method call.
